verb.description: Enforce the forfeit of (a surety for bail or other recognizance)
examples: the Court may order the recognizance to be estreated

noun.description: A copy of a court record for use in the enforcement of a fine or forfeiture of a recognizance.
examples: new calendars were introduced to record estreats

origin: Middle English: from Old French estraite, feminine past participle of estraire, from Latin extrahere draw out (see extract).
